Incident.Summary: The victim sent a package to a scammer.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: VIDEO/AUDIO RECORDINGS: CAR B-35 // BODY-WORN CAMERA NOT AVAILABLE // IN-CAR CAMERA NOT AVAILABLE. ATTACHMENTS: Nineteen (19) digital photographs of the Facebook conversation. Four (4) copies of email conversations. One (1) copy of the original camera purchase receipt. One (1) copy of shipping receipt. VICTIM: Kathleen Elizabeth Ricker (W/F DOB: 8/14/1981) WITNESS/NEIGHBORHOOD CHECK: Due to the nature of the crime, no checks were conducted. SUSPECT(S): Unknown SCENE PROCESSING: Nineteen digital photographs of the Facebook conversation were captured. NARRATIVE: On 1/23/2023 at 1840 hours, I responded to the Maryland State Police Frederick Barrack in reference to a fraud report. I made contact with the complainant, Kathleen Elizabeth Ricker (W/F DOB: 8/14/1981), who was identified by her Maryland Drivers License. Ricker advised she was scammed during a Facebook Marketplace transaction. Ricker was attempting to sell her Canon EOS R5 Mirrorless Digital Camera (S/N: 914147C00292AA21262026001496). Ricker posted her Canon camera on Facebook Marketplace for $3,700.00 on 1/20/2023. A Facebook user, Philip Mullis contacted Ricker and advised he would like to purchase the camera. Mullis advised he is not local, and requested Ricker ship the camera to Florida, and advised he would pay for the shipping and the camera. Ricker advised she would ship the camera and advised she would accept payment via Venmo. Mullis advised he did not have Venmo, and could pay via Marketplace. Mullis advised he would send the payment through Marketplace and Ricker would not receive it until the package was shipped and delivered to Mullis. Mullis sent Ricker an email posing as Facebook confirming the payment has been received and will be deposited into Rickers account once the package has been received by Mullis. Mullis provided Ricker an address of 5930 NW 99th Ave Unit 10, Doral, FL 33178. On 1/21/2023, Ricker drove to FedEx and shipped the package to Doral, Florida. The package was delivered on 1/23/2023 at approximately 1300 hours. When Ricker did not receive the payment, she discovered she was scammed. Ricker responded to the Maryland State Police Frederick Barrack to file a police report. One 1/23/2023 at approximately 1923 hours, I contacted the Miami-Dade Police Department in reference to the address of5930 NW 99th Ave Unit 10, Doral, FL 33178. I requested they send an officer to the address to attempt to locate the package and identify anyone at the residence. Upon arrival, Officer Cruz #450, Miami-Dade Police Department, discovered the address was a business, The business, My Package Forwarder was gated off. Officer Cruz could not make entry into the business complex. I requested officers respond back to the business on 1/24/2023 at 0930 hours to attempt to locate the package. On 1/23/2023 at approximately 2225 hours, the cameras serial number (914147C00292AA21262026001496) was entered into NCIC as stolen (NIC # A777234401). I went onto My Package Forwarders website and completed a fraud report with Rickers information. On 1/23/2023 at 2309 hours, Ricker received contact from My Package Forwarder, confirming the fraud report was received and verified. A My Package Forwarder representative advised the package was being shipped to Nigeria. Ricker was given the tracking number for the package. Ricker called FedEx and requested the package transit be stopped. On 1/27/2023, Ricker contacted me and advised the package had been stopped in France. Ricker advised FedEx was going to ship the camera back to her. All events occurred in Frederick County, Maryland. CASE STATUS:I request this case remain open, pending further information from the victim.

NARRATIVE: On 2/28/2023, Kathleen Ricker contacted me via email to update me on the disposition of her package. FedEx was able to stop the transit of the package in Paris, France. Ricker requested FedEx to ship the package back to her address, but FedEx shipped it to My Package Forwarder in Florida. Ricker contacted My Package Forwarder and requested they ship the camera back to her. The camera was shipped back to Ricker and received on 3/9/2023. Ricker advised the camera is in its original condition. The MSP Frederick Barrack PCO removed the camera from NCIC. CASE STATUS: I request this case be closed, camera has been returned. All events occurred in Frederick County, Maryland.
